references.reason: This paper is foundational to auction theory and provides the benchmark for revenue maximization in settings with rational bidders, which is contrasted in this paper's study of learning agents.

This paper is directly related and foundational to the work presented, establishing a surprising result about the lack of convergence to truthful bidding in second-price auctions with learning agents.

This paper introduces the concept of mean-based no-regret learning algorithms, which are central to the learning model used in the main paper, and also provides crucial background on the convergence properties of these algorithms.

references.paper_title: Convergence analysis of no-regret bidding algorithms in repeated auctions
references.reason: This paper studies no-regret learning algorithms in repeated auctions, but with i.i.d. valuations in each round, establishing a key comparison to the main paper's persistent valuations setting.

references.paper_title: The Impact of AI Design on Pricing
references.reason: This paper investigates the impact of AI on pricing, providing context and motivation for studying learning agents in auctions, a critical aspect of the main paper's focus.
